greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array T read by rows: T(n,0) = 1 for n >= 0; T(1,1) = 1; and for n >= 2, T(n,k) = T(n-1,k-1) + T(n-1,k) for k = 1,2,...,[(n+1)/2]; T(n,n/2 + 1) = T(n-1,n/2) if n is even.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of the triangle, flattened
formula: T(n, k) = binomial(n, k) - binomial(n, k-3). - Darko Marinov (marinov(AT)lcs.mit.edu), May 17 2001
Sum_{k=0..floor((n+2)/2)} T(n, k) = A026010(n). - _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 18 2021
mathematica: T[n_, k_]:= Binomial[n, k] - Binomial[n, k-3];
Join[{1}, Table[T[n, k], {n,14}, {k,0,Floor[(n+2)/2]}]//Flatten] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 18 2021 *)
program: (Sage) [1]+flatten([[binomial(n,k) - binomial(n,k-3) for k in (0..(n+2)//2)] for n in (1..15)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 18 2021
(Magma) [1] cat [Binomial(n,k) - Binomial(n,k-3): k in [0..Floor((n+2)/2)], n in [1..15]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 18 2021
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
